post.Title: Java desktop links of the week, May 18
post.Content:
Another round of weekly links - enjoy :-)

JavaFX

  • To blow my own trumpet, this week I finally got my JEP published as a candidate for JDK 9. JEP 253 is titled 'Prepare JavaFX UI Controls & CSS APIs for Modularization', and that is exactly what it is about :-)
  • Alexander Casall has posted about mvvmFX, a library for Model-View-ViewModel with JavaFX.
  • Jens Deters has released FontAwesomeFX 8.4, which fixes a few bugs and adds a few new features.
  • The Gluon guys have posted a quick teaser trailer of the Gluon Glisten library that will be coming out soon. Pretty epic music :-)
  • Ren√© Jahn has posted to announce the first release of the JVx JavaFX UI library.
  • Christoph Keimel has posted about filtering a JavaFX TreeView.
  • Wolfgang Weigend has posted about automated testing of JavaFX UI components - and one of the screenshots of the test tool looks strangely a lot like the 3D viewer in Scenic View....

That's all - catch you next week. Bye! :-)
